The Pythagorean theorem:

$$
a^2 + b^2 = c^2

.var {c} {.pow {.add {.pow {.a} to:{2}} to:{.pow {.b} to:{2}}} to:{0.5}}

## Code Integration

### Syntax Highlighting

```javascript
function createQuarkdownDocument(content) {
    const compiler = new QuarkdownCompiler();
    return compiler.compile(content, {
        doctype: 'slides',
        theme: 'darko'
    });
}
```

### Custom Functions

```markdown
.function {highlight}
    text color:
    .center
        **✨ .text ✨**
        
        Color: .color

.highlight {Important Message} color:{blue}
```

## Performance Comparison

| Feature | LaTeX | Standard Markdown | Quarkdown |
|---------|-------|------------------|-----------|
| Compile Speed | Slow | Fast | **Ultra Fast** |
| Learning Curve | Steep | Easy | **Moderate** |
| Programming | Limited | None | **Full** |
| Layout Control | Excellent | Basic | **Excellent** |
| Live Preview | No | Basic | **Advanced** |

.center
⚡ **Millisecond compilation times vs. seconds in LaTeX**

## Getting Started

### Installation

```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/iamgio/quarkdown.git

# Install VS Code extension
code --install-extension quarkdown-vscode

# Create your first document
quarkdown create my-project
```

### Your First Document

```markdown
.docname {My First Document}
.docauthor {Your Name}

# Hello, Quarkdown!

.var {magic} {✨}

This is .magic amazing .magic
```
